casebody.data:
WILLIAM CASTLE v. HORATIO N. CARR. ON FOREIGN ATTACHMENT. Matter of Practice. Stock of an incorporated company, may be sold by auditors, in attachment. Samuel Cassedy,

attorney for the plaintiff, stated to the Court, that the property attached is that of a corporate body. That he *395had looked into the attachment law, with a view to learn how to obtain the stock or the proceeds thereof; and that a proceeding by soire faeias, did not appear to be the mode, because stock could not be sold by execution. And he moved for an order on the auditors to sell the same.

By the Court.

Take the order to sell the stock.

Rule ordered.
